posts.raw_content:
I’m true MAGA. I voted Trump because I thought he represented what I believe the best. It’s clear he’s bought and paid for. 

1. The Epstein files. 
- there is no good reason not to release them. High level pedos are being protected whether you like it or not. 


2. Corrupt judges
- Trump needs to assert the power of the executive as the chief law enforcement officer and arrest these people. Playing ball with them is only feeding the fire. 


3. FISA courts/patriot act
- there is no serious push to dismantle this. This is setting the stage for continued spying on Americans. 

4. H1bs
- I work in software. My last company was all DEI (part of why I left). I routinely saw them turn away talented whites. They do h1bs to suppress wages. Simple as. Trump is pushing it because he’s beholden to his donors and friends. 

5. Illegals 
- it’s too slow. We need large scale roundups and deportations. We need exec orders that illegals cannot get healthcare even at emergency rooms. 

6. Foreign wars
- we pay for the entire government of Ukraine and now we’re doing regime change in Venezuela. Why? Because it’s a money maker for donors and corrupt politicians who get kick backs from the war complex. 

7. China
- we’re admitting their spies into our country and have done nothing to seize their land. 

8. Spending
- we’re spending ourselves into oblivion. He should have vetoed this CR and forced an actual budget. 

9. EBT 
- we’re subsidizing people that hate us and they’re replacing us because of it. 

10. Bondi/the FBI
- they’re covering up crimes and not charging the commies. Anyone violating their oath in office knowingly violating the constitution should be arrested. I’m hardline on this. 


I don’t want to hear that I’m the problem. I’m not. Trump is. The point of this post is to remind you that we’re free thinkers, not cult of personality followers. Best keep your powder dry because the tough things that must be done aren’t happening. As a result the foreigners will vote for commies and continue removing our rights and spending us into oblivion.
